page.title: 19GUNSTONE MILL CONTD.
page.content: Then we went to see where the dairy cows (Freisian herd) were milked.It is like a large shed and is called the Milking Parlour.Each cow has its own compartment and there are about 16 cows milked at a time.The cows are machine milked twice a day - at about 8 o'clock in the morning and 5.30 in the evening.A huge milk tanker collects milk from the farm at 8.30am. There is a vacuum pump to milk the cows,the milk flows through stainless steel pipes through to a huge tank in the dairy.The milk is kept cool and on ice to keep it fresh.The tank holds about 900 litres. Inside the tank there is a winder that turns every 2 hours for 3 minutes to keep the fat from settling.Once the milk is removed the tank,pipes and equipment are all thoroughly washed and sterilised ready for next time.
